}} 'Sir Christopher Frank Carandini Lee', , (born 27 May 1922) is an English
actor and singer. Lee initially portrayed villains and became best known for his
role as Count Dracula in a string of popular Hammer Horror films. Other notable
roles include Francisco Scaramanga in the James Bond film [[The Man with the
Golden Gun (film)|The Man with the Golden Gun]] (1974), Saruman in ''The Lord of
the Rings'' film trilogy (2001â2003) and ''The Hobbit'' film trilogy
(2012â2014), and Count Dooku in the final two films of the ''Star Wars'' prequel
trilogy (2002, 2005).

He was knighted for services to drama and charity in 2009, and received the
BAFTA Fellowship in 2011. [http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/uk/8334492.stm "Hammer
Horror star Lee knighted"]. BBC. Retrieved 7 May 2012 [http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-
12395181 "Christopher Lee to receive Bafta Fellowship"]. BBC. Retrieved 7 May
2012 Lee considers his most important role to be that of Pakistan's
founder Muhammad Ali Jinnah in the biopic [[Jinnah (film)|Jinnah]] (1998), and
his best role to be Lord Summerisle in the British cult classic [[The Wicker Man
(1973 film)|The Wicker Man]] (1973), which he also considers his best
film. [http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CE_1ofnBFos Christopher Lee talks
about his favourite role], in press conference at Brussels International
Fantastic Film Festival 21 March 2002 (YouTube video)

Always noted as an actor for his deep, strong voice, he has, more recently, also
taken to using his singing ability, recording various opera and musical pieces
between 1986 and 1998 and the symphonic metal album [[Charlemagne: By the Sword
and the Cross]] in 2010 after having worked with several metal bands since 2005.
The heavy metal follow-up titled [[Charlemagne: The Omens of Death]] was
released on 27 May 2013. http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-
18367892 He was honoured with the "Spirit of Metal"
award in the 2010 Metal Hammer Golden God awards ceremony.
